meanings.sent1: The wo puppy looked sad and lonely.
meanings.sent2: She let out a wo sigh when she heard the news.
meanings.sent3: The wo clouds seemed to cry tears of rain.
meanings.sent4: His wo face reflected the pain he felt inside.
meanings.sent5: The wo melody of the song touched everyone's hearts.

meanings.definition: Used to express surprise or admiration.
meanings.sent1: Wo! That magic trick was amazing!
meanings.sent2: Wo, I didn't expect to see you here!
meanings.sent3: Wo, that's a huge cake for the party!
meanings.sent4: Her talent made everyone go wo in amazement.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display left the crowd shouting wo in awe.

meanings.definition: A command to stop or desist.
meanings.sent1: He shouted a loud wo to halt the car.
meanings.sent2: The referee's wo signaled the end of the match.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's wo made the students freeze in place.
meanings.sent4: The commander's wo echoed through the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The final wo brought the chaotic scene to a sudden stop.
